text: Bridgnorth Castle is a castle in the town of Bridgnorth, Shropshire, England. == Details == The castle was founded in 1101 by Robert de Belleme. He tortured men and women and was even said to have gouged his godson's eyes out with his own fingernails.Kathleen Thompson, 'Orderic Vitalis and Robert of BellÃªme', Journal of Medieval History, Vol. 20 (1994), p. 133 During the English Civil War, in 1646, Oliver Cromwell and his cavaliers attacked roundhead Bridgnorth. By the time the castle was in ruins, the entire town was on fire. After a three-week siege, Cromwell was successful and he ordered that the castle be demolished in 1647.Bridgnorth Castle , ShropshireTourism.co.uk, accessed May 2010 The castle leans at more of an angle than the Leaning Tower of Pisa by 4 times.The Leaning Tower of Bridgnorth, Shropshire, Time Team, episode aired 18 March 2001, accessed May 2010 == Related pages == *Lavington's hole == References == == Sources == * Fry, Plantagenet Somerset, The David & Charles Book of Castles, David & Charles, 1980.
